My Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare Review.  Ok, so I have played A LOT of this game so i feel that i'm justified in saying  that this game is FANTASTIC. In this review i will go through the pros and cons  of purchasing this game. I am trying to come from a perspective of someone who  has played this game since 2008, I have purchased this game 4 times, for Xbox  360, PS3, Retail Box and Steam. Over the 4 versions of the game I would say that  I have played a good 1000 hours. Yet I keep coming back for some reason. Cod4 is  one of the games that I play each and every day. I mostly play Promod, but I dip  into Non-modded every now and then.  Pros: Mod Support, many, many mods for this game. There is a whole separate game of  just mods. To name a few there is Prop Hunt, Promod, One in the chamber and a  multitude of others. Smooth uninterrupted game play, I wish more games had this these days. From the ground up this game was made to be as smooth as possible.  Developer Console, this is a biggy in my books. Not enough games these days have this. This is the command line that you can use to edit any settings that you would like, you can load maps, change  Sensitivity aswell as other settings such as FOV and maxfps. With commands like cg_fov 80 and  com_maxfps 250.  Cons: There are very few cons for this game. Some of the biggest and most prevalent are  the aim botters and silent aim users. If anything this is what will send you over  the edge. Another thing is that most of the servers are unpopulated. Don’t get me wrong,  there is still a huge player base in CoD4. Its just that I wish there were more.  Thank you for reading this review and I hope that it will influence your purchase  in a good way. Cheers, Virconium

War rages on in the fourth edition of Activision's acclaimed war game. For the first time in the series, Call of Duty moves away from WWII to the modern battlefield. Armed with an arsenal of advanced and powerful modern day firepower, players are transported to treacherous hotspots around the globe to take on a rogue enemy group threatening the world. As both a U.S Marine and British S.A.S. soldier fighting through an unfolding story full of twists and turns, players use sophisticated technology, superior firepower and coordinated land and air strikes on a battlefield where speed, accuracy and communication are essential to victory. The epic title also delivers an added depth of multiplayer action providing online fans an all-new community of persistence, addictive and customizable gameplay.  Of course, if you're looking for longevity, that's where the multiplayer comes in. Up to 18 players can get online and get into a match on one of 16 different maps. Many of the levels are taken from portions of the single-player and they offer a healthy mix of wide-open, sniper-friendly areas and tight, almost cramped spaces where grenades and shotguns are the order of the day. There are six game modes to choose from. The old standby is team deathmatch, though you can also play in a free-for-all deathmatch, which isn't as much fun as the team modes. The other modes are more objective-oriented, and a couple of those have you lugging bombs across the map to blow up enemy equipment, or preventing the enemy from blowing up your base. Others have you capturing control points. Lastly, you can change up the game rules a bit with a hardcore setting that makes weapons more realistically damaging or an old-school mode that puts weapons on the ground as pickups and generally moves away from the simulation side of things.

I should preface this with the admittance that I am not a fan of First Person Shooters. I played the original Medal of Honor and Call of Duty games before the franchises became more focused on special effects, shock value, and multiplayer than they were about storylines; but I had a falling out with the story when $60 games couldn't be expected to offer any more than three hours of enjoyment outside of dealing with the horde of snotty kids online.  I did, however, play through Modern Warfare 1 and 2 as they went on sale, and I was thoroughly impressed. As you can expect just by looking at the store page, the game is visually stunning. What you don't see, however, is the storylines (plural) that you follow as Army Rangers and Spec Ops fight to ensure America's continued global dominance amidst emerging threats (MW 1) and to ensure America's survival as all hell breaks loose (MW 2). While the single player game is challenging (frustratingly so on some parts), the story line only gives you about 5 - 6 hours of gameplay and doesn't offer any outside-of-story single player enjoyability as you would see in Modern Warfare 2.  All in all, I'd give the game an 6/10.

Call of Duty 4 Modern Warfare is a first-person shooter action video game developed by Infinity Ward and published by Activision 2007 .  Groups of Marines and British SAS must fight an ultranationalist group that plans a third world war . The player plays as various characters in the story. Yet the narrative is linear and the game looking to get a cinematic effect .  COD 4 Modern Warfare renewed the graphics engine of the previous games in the series in a big way. It had great success and to some extent became the spiritual successor of Counter Strike . It had two sequels that continue the story to its end in Modern Warfare 3. The game has a very mature multiplayer component where the player can call air attacks and reconnaissance vehicles.  Call of Duty 4 Modern Warfare really innovated in the genre. It took the war to the modern era , a battle without pause and film like scenes. Hundreds of shots , stealth, sniper attacks , and a variety of weapons immerse us in this world war. In fact , although the following Call of Duty are much more up to date, they seem an extension of this brilliant game . The feeling of being in the ghost town near Pipriat Chernobyl is shocking , COD MW4 was technologically wonderful in 2007.  The game sold over 13 million copies in two years and obtained a score of 94 out of 100 on sites like Metacritic or GameRankings .  The game was released for Windows PC , PS3 and XBOX 360. Grupos de Marines y SAS britanicos deben combatir a un grupo ultranacionalista que planea una tercera guerra mundial. El jugador participa como varios personajes en la historia. Tuvo grán éxito y en alguna medida se convirtió en el sucesor espiritual del Counter Strike. Tuvo dos secuelas que continúan con la historia hasta su fin en el Modern Warfare 3. El juego tiene un componente multijugador muy desarrollado donde el jugador puede llamar a vehículos aéreos de ataque y reconocimiento.   El Call of Duty Modern Warfare realmente innovó en el género. Nos llevó por primera vez a la guerra moderna, con un combate sin pausa y escenas 'de película' soprendentes. Centenares de disparos, sigilo, ataques Sniper, y una gran variedad de armas nos sumergen en este mundo en guerra. De hecho, si bien los siguientes Call of Duty son mucho mas modernos, parecen una extensión de este brillante juego. La sensación de estar en la ciudad fantasma de Pipriat cerca de Chernobil es impactante, tecnológicamente el COD MW4 fue una maravilla del 2007.  El juego vendió mas de 13 millones de copias en dos años y obtuvo un puntaje de 94 sobre 100 en sitios de críticos como Metacritic o GameRankings.  El juego se lanzó para PC bajo Windows, PS3 y XBOX 360. La versión de windows requería la API DirectX 9.0c. All in all, I give this game as of today, May, 25th 2014, a 10 out of 10!!!! I would recommend this game to anyone who is getting into PC gaming, people who are looking to play it again for a bit of nostalgia, or just someone looking to complete their CoD collection! Unfortunately, due to its age and some other factors, CoD4 has lost this glimmer.   As far as the game itself, it's the last good Call of Duty, honestly. The PC version's dedicated servers have, for the most part, kept hackers at bay, but since Punkbuster is a pain to deal with, I don't feel like installing it, and thus have to play on unprotected servers. (I have Windows 8.1, and I'm honestly surprised CoD4 runs as well as it does on my system. The last time I tried installing Punkbuster for CoD4, it gave me a whole bunch of random errors that I didn't feel like dealing with.)  One thing I liked about Call of Duty in the past is that it was relatively simple, CoD4 being no exception. WaW and even leading up to Black Ops things were still pretty simple. In MW2 I used to be able to tell, just by its firing sound, what weapon was used to kill someone, and relatively how far away. Now, in Ghosts, there's a whole bunch of stuff that I'm not willing to put in the effort to comprehend. I can't even imagine what Advanced Warfare is going to be like.   Call of Duty as a whole has become a pit of despair. ...There seems to be a thing about golden guns that really seems to get at people, and the effect it's had on the industry is not good. A lot of free FPSs that I play to kill time feature golden guns, but can only be bought with its respective premium currency - I can only deduce that this is due to the popularity of golden guns in the Call of Duty series, and they have been implemented as an attempt to make more profit. But, sorry, I'm going off on a tangent. I should be writing about CoD4.  Back in the day, you used to be able to grab a few friends, party up on Xbox Live, and play a good game of Search with good people. It was great. The feeling of brotherhood I got during those days was only matched by Halo 3. Now, I can't find a legitimate game. I was playing TDM today, with 40 players on Killhouse.  40 PLAYERS ON KILLHOUSE!!   That's TOO MANY PEOPLE. Now, maybe this is because I can't use Punkbuster, but I can't find a server with a good population that has less than a 30-player cap. 30 is too many! The maps are too small and the game is too fast-paced for that kind of a cap. 30 players is more of a low-population Battlefield server, which has the size of maps needed to support that.  And another thing - the darned auto-balance is horrible. Way to separate me from my friends while we're playing, server...I think that feature is stock, but it's still bad. This never happened on console, and we never had any issues with balance.  Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare has a very special place in my heart. It's painful to see it in this state - not just the PC version, but across all platforms.  I *want* to recommend it. But I can't. It's not worth $20 for a completely ruined game. I'm sorry.
